Description: 15.935: NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM PROJECTSTEMPLATE: THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THENATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCEAGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE AFEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THE COMPLEX HISTORY AND LEGACY OF SPANISH COLONIALISM, THE ANZA EXPEDITION, AND THE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL THROUGH PARTNERSHIP BUILDING ACTIVITIES, THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED WORKSHOPS, AND THROUGH USING THE TRAIL AS A SETTING FOR BUILDING RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BRIDGE LOCAL COMMUNITIES  FOCUSING ON TRIBAL PARTNERS AND NON-TRADITIONAL TRAIL USERS  AND CURRENT PARTNERS USING THE ANZA TRAIL ITSELF AS THE BINDING THREAD. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, ORINDIVIDUALS.

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THIS WILL PROMOTE, PROTECTION, AND INCREASE ACCESS FOR EXPERIENCES ALONG HIKING AND OTHER TRAILS.. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.

15.935: NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM PROJECTSTHE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THENATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCEAGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE AFEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THIS PUBLIC EVENT INCLUDES OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO YOUTH AND PUBLIC AT LARGE BY COSTUMED INTERPRETERS IN PERIOD CLOTHING. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON CONNECTING THE PUBLIC TO THE HISTORY AND LEGACY OF THE ANZA EXPEDITION AND THE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL BY SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER RE-ENACTMENT PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH EVENTS AND WORKSHOPS PERFORMED FOR VOLUNTEERS MANAGED THROUGH THE TUBAC PRESIDIO STATE HISTORICAL PARK AND AT SITES ALONG THE ENTIRE ROUTE OF THE ANZA TRAIL. THIS PROJECT FUNDS VOLUNTEER RE-ENACTMENT TRAVEL AND MATERIAL EXPENSES TO PARTICIPATE IN EVENTS ALONG THE TRAIL. THIS PROJECT AUTHORIZES FUNDS FOR THE UPKEEP OF EXISTING RE-ENACTMENT SUPPLIES AND MATERIALS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, ORINDIVIDUALS.

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SERVE AS A PIOLET PROJECT TOWARDS THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE BERNALILLO COUNTY EL CAMINO REAL DEVELOPMENT CONCEPT PLAN. THIS PROJECT FUNDS CONTRACT ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING SERVICES TO COMPLETE CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS FOR CUSTOM EL CAMINO REAL NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL MONUMENT BASES AND SIGNS, AND ONE SITE PLAN DETAILING A MONUMENT SIGN TAILORED TO A SPECIFIC SITE. HISTORIC, MODERN, AND RECREATIONAL TRAILS ARE A MAJOR ASSET, ECONOMIC STIMULANT, AND THEME FOR THE AREA, AND ARE VALUED AS A PUBLIC BENEFIT. WHEN COMPLETE, THIS PIOLET PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND GENERATE MOMENTUM FOR THE COUNTY AND CITY TO CONTINUE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DEVELOPMENT CONCEPT PLAN.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL FAMILY, PROFIT ORGANIZATION, QUASI-PUBLIC NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, OTHER PRIVATE INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, ANYONE GENERAL PUBLIC, INTERSTATE, NATIVE AMERICAN ORGANIZATIONS, INTRASTATE, STATE, LOCAL, FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, GENERAL PUBLIC, AND STATES OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THIS PARTNERSHIP PROJECT STIMULATES INCREASED OUTDOOR RECREATION ACCESS TO PARKS AND TRAILS, CONSERVATION OF TRAIL-RELATED LANDS, AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THEM AND WITH ADJACENT COMMUNITIES. THE AGREEMENT IMPLEMENTS THE INTENT OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM ACT FOR THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO EMPOWER LOCAL, REGIONAL, AND STATE AGENCIES WITH THE ABILITY TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE SEGMENTS OF THE POTOMAC HERITAGE NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL AND TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUTDOOR RECREATION AS WELL AS FOR THE ASSOCIATED COMMUNITY HEALTH AND ECONOMIC BENEFITS. THIS PROJECT WILL ENCOURAGE PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND VISITORS TO ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN TRAIL STEWARDSHIP EFFORTS THROUGH ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM DEFERRED MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ON APPALACHIAN TRAIL FACILITIES LOCATED IN MULTIPLE STATES. WORK WILL REHABILITATE CRITICAL FACILITY ASSETS SUCH AS, PRIVIES, CAMP SITES, AND PARKING AREAS.  PROJECT WORK WILL ALSO REPAIR AND REHABILITATE SEVERAL MILES OF HEAVILY DEGRADED AND ERODED TRAIL BY INSTALLING EROSION CONTROLLING STRUCTURES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.

CONDUCT ANNUAL MARCH ALONG OVERMOUNTAIN VICTORY NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL TO EDUCATE YOUTH AND GENERAL PUBLIC - THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND OVERMOUNTAIN TRAIL ASSOCIATION WILL WORK WITH NEIGHBORING PARTNERS AND COMMUNITIES ALONG THE 330-MILE TRAIL ROUTE TO HOST THE 243RD  ANNUAL COMMEMORATIVE MARCH FROM ABINGDON TO KINGS MOUNTAIN NATIONAL MILITARY PARK, HIGHLIGHTING NOT ONLY THE HISTORY OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR AND THE CAMPAIGN, BUT ALSO THE DAILY LIFE AND EXPERIENCES OF MEN, WOMEN, CHILDREN AND MINORITIES DURING THAT ERA. THE PUBLIC AND ROUGHLY 12,000 SCHOOL CHILDREN WILL HAVE ACCESS TO VARIOUS PORTIONS OF THE TRAIL AND WILL LEARN ABOUT THE HISTORIC CAMPAIGN OF THE OVERMOUNTAIN MEN EN ROUTE TO THE BATTLE OF KINGS MOUNTAIN.

THE OREGON AND CALIFORNIA NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS ASSOCIATION WILL ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE OREGON AND CALIFORNIA NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS  ACCELERATE THE EFFORT TO ACQUIRE AND DEVELOP THE TRAILS BY SECURING PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR INVOLVEMENT  INCREASE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC AWARENESS AND USE OF THE TRAILS AND THEIR SUPPORT FOR ITS COMPLETE DEVELOPMENT  AND SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE STAFF CAPABILITIES AND VOLUNTEER EFFORTS OF THE ASSOCIATION IN TAKING A LEADING ROLE WITHIN THE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR IN ACQUIRING, PLANNING, DEVELOPING, PROTECTING, AND MAINTAINING THE TRAILS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, ORINDIVIDUALS.FOR MORE INFORMATION AND GUIDANCE, REFER TO NPS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY GUIDANCE DOCUMENT ON USASPENDING.GOV AWARD DESCRIPTIONS (PROJECT ABSTRACTS), OR CONTACT THE NPS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY OFFICE AT FINANCIAL ASSITANCE POLICY NPS.GOV.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT (TA) IS TO EXECUTE PROJECTS THAT HELP IMPLEMENT THE WASHINGTON-ROCHAMBEAU REVOLUTIONARY ROUTE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS (WARO) LONG RANGE INTERPRETIVE PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH P.L. 111-11 5204. THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT WILL ENGAGE PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND THE PUBLIC TO INSPIRE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNITY PRIDE, AND SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP OF WAROS RESOURCES WHILE STRENGTHENING THE VALUE OF WARO AS AN ASSET TO THE PARK SYSTEM. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS TA INCLUDE MAINTAIN   UPDATE INTERACTIVE WEBSITE WITH NEW STORIES, EVENTS LISTINGS, STORYLINES, PRESENTATIONS, ETC.  DEVELOP INTERPRETIVE CONTENT FOR PRINT AND MEDIA PUBLICATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRAIL  AND PLAN   DELIVER OR SUPPORT SPECIAL EVENTS   PROGRAMS. THROUGH PROVIDING INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS THAT LEAD TO GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF WARO, SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THE TA OCCURRING FROM JUNE 1, 2023 THROUGH MAY 31, 2024 WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARD THE PRESERVATION, PROTECTION, AND DEVELOPMENT OF COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM WITHIN WARO. THIS INCLUDES A STRONG EMPHASIS ON LOCAL AND VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF RESOURCES WITHIN WARO. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, AND INDIVIDUALS.

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE VOLUNTEER TRAIL CLUBS, TRAIL CREWS, AND INDIVIDUAL VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS TRAIL-WIDE, INCLUDING MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATION, SAFETY AND LEADERSHIP TRAINING, RECRUITMENT, RECOGNITION, AND COORDINATION OF VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.

15.935  NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM PROJECTSTHE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THENATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA. THIS STAR SPANGLED BANNER NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL PROJECT PROVIDES STUDENTS FROM MARYLANDS EASTERN SHORE WITH A TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE THAT CONNECTS THEM WITH THE SIGNIFICANT EVENTS FROM THE WAR OF 1812 THAT TOOK PLACE IN THEIR COMMUNITY. IT INVOLVES PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS AND MEANINGFUL OUTDOOR EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES FOR THEIR STUDENTS. TEACHERS AND STUDENTS THEN DESIGN, PARTICIPATE IN, AND SHARE LEGACY PROJECTS WITH THEIR BROADER SCHOOL COMMUNITIES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS.A.PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE STUDENTS FROM MARYLANDS EASTERN SHORE WITH A TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE THAT CONNECTS THEM WITH THE SIGNIFICANT EVENTS FROM THE WAR OF 1812 THAT TOOK PLACE IN THEIR COMMUNITY.  THROUGH THIS EXPERIENCE, STUDENTS WILL BE EMPOWERED TO BECOME THE CARETAKERS OF THE LOCAL CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AND STAR SPANGLED BANNER NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (TRAIL). B.PROJECT OBJECTIVES  THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS AS WELL AS MEANINGFUL OUTDOOR EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES FOR THEIR STUDENTS.  IN TURN, THE TEACHERS AND STUDENTS DESIGN, PARTICIPATE IN, AND SHARE LEGACY LEARNING PROJECTS WITH THEIR BROADER SCHOOL COMMUNITIES.  THE PROGRAM WILL PROMOTE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT IN TRAIL COMMUNITIES AND INTRODUCE A NEW GENERATION OF STUDENTS TO THE NPS.

CONNECTING THE OVERMOUNTAIN VICTORY TRAIL TO THE YAKIN VALLEY HERITAGE CENTER   THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP INTERPRETIVE MEDIA AND CONSTRUCT AN INTERPRETIVE TRAIL TO PROVIDE INFORMATION TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT THE OVERMOUNTAIN VICTORY NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL  OVVI   AND TO FACILITATE THE DESIGN OF A PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE WHICH WILL PROVIDE DIRECT ACCESS TO THE OVVI CERTIFIED SEGMENT AT ITS EASTERN TERMINUS FROM THE YADKIN VALLEY HERITAGE CENTER, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE TOWN OF ELKIN  THE TOWN OF ELKIN WILL USE THE DESIGN TO LATER CONSTRUCT THE BRIDGE  AS A RESULT, THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE TRAIL AND ENHANCE RELATIONSHIPS AND ENGAGEMENT WITH THE TOWN OF ELKIN AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES  MILESTONES INCLUDE FABRICATING INTERPRETIVE PANELS BY FEBRUARY 2023 AND COMPLETING CONNECTOR TRAIL BY JUNE 2023 AND TRAIL BRIDGE DESIGN BY AUGUST 2023

PURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE COOPERATIVELY THE MISSIONS OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND THE RECIPIENT THROUGH RESEARCHING RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH THE WASHINGTON ROCHAMBEAU REVOLUTIONARY ROUTE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL  WARO  AND IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE WARO LONG RANGE INTERPRETIVE PLAN AND COMMEMORATING AMERICA S 250TH ANNIVERSARY SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES COORDINATING WITH PARTNER TO PROMOTE PROGRAMMING WHICH ENGAGES, INSPIRES, AND EDUCATES THE PUBLIC ABOUT WARO AND ITS RESOURCES RECPIENT WILL PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING AND SPECIAL EVENTS THAT WILL ENGAGE INTERGENERATIONAL VISITORS ON THE HISTORY OF THE WASHINGTON ROCHAMBEAU REVOLUTIONARY ROUTE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL, AS IT PERTAINS TO FRANCE S SUPPORT TO AMERICA DURING THE REVOLUTION, WITH EMPHASIS ON THE PERIOD OF 1780 TO 1782 PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL RESOURCES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THIS AND FUTURE GENERATIONS, PURSUANT TO THE LEGAL AUTHORITIES AUTHORIZING THIS ACTIVITY  AND TO PROVIDE ENHANCED PUBLIC INTERPRETATION, EDUCATION AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO WARO RESOURCES BENEFICIARIES MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION  MAR , PUBLIC

PURPOSE OF THE AWARD TO EXPAND THE NPS KNOWLEDGE OF WEROWOCOMOCO AND OTHER SITES ALONG THE CAPTAIN JOHN SMITH NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL THROUGH RESEARCH AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENT INVOLVEMENT  THE INFORMATION AND PRODUCTS IDENTIFIED AND DEVELOPED BY THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE SHARED THROUGH A VARIETY OF STRATEGIES TO INCREASE TRIBAL INVOLVEMENT, PUBLIC AWARENESS, KNOWLEDGE, AND SUPPORT FOR CULTURAL LANDSCAPE PRESERVATION ALONG THE CAPTAIN JOHN SMITH CHESAPEAKE TRAIL AND STEWARDSHIP OF A SIGNIFICANT NPS OWNED NATIVE AMERICAN SITE SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES THROUGH THE APPLICATION OF THE INDIGENOUS CULTURAL LANDSCAPE  ICL  METHODOLOGY A SITE SPECIFIC ANALYSIS OF WEROWOCOMOCO WILL CONSOLIDATE PREVIOUS RESEARCH DOCUMENTATION INTO A SINGLE SOURCE AND INCORPORATE NEW AND ADDITIONAL FINDINGS, AS RESULT OF ARCHEOLOGY, IDENTIFICATION OF NATIVE PLANTS, ROADS AND NATIVE TRAILS, GEOPHYSICS, ORAL HISTORIES, ETC  REFINEMENT OF THE WEROWOCOMOCO ARCHEOLOGICAL OVERVIEW AND ASSESSMENT TO ENHANCE NPS KNOWLEDGE OF THE SITE  INCORPORATE NEW RESEARCH FINDINGS AND UPDATE ARCHEOLOGICAL SITE DATA DEVELOPMENT OF AN EDUCATIONAL VIDEO FOCUSED ON INDIGENOUS VALUES OF WEROWOCOMOCO THAT CREATES OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL CITIZENS TO RECONNECT WITH THE SITE AND FOR PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT INTERPRETATION OF NATIVE LIFEWAYS THRU THE CONTINUATION OF THE MARITIME CRAFT SCHOOL PROGRAM MODEL PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO CONTINUE THE RECONNECTION OF VIRGINIA RECOGNIZED TRIBES TO WEROWOCOMOCO, EXPANSION OF NPS KNOWLEDGE OF WEROWOCOMOCO, AND ENGAGEMENT OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN INDIGENOUS HISTORY ALONG THE CAPTAIN JOHN SMITH CHESAPEAKE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL  PROJECTS WILL TAKE PLACE BETWEEN SEPTEMBER 2022 AND SEPTEMBER 2024 BENEFICIARIES THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE OPPORTUNITIES CREATED BY NPS AND THE RECIPIENT TO PROMOTE AND INVOLVE THE PUBLIC IN HANDS ON ARCHAEOLOGY, PRESERVATION, AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES WITHIN VIRGINIA S MIDDLE PENINSULA AND SURROUNDING AREAS

PURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT   THIS PROJECT PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL LANDSCAPE PARTNERSHIP  ATLP  TO ADVANCE THE PRESERVATION OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL VALUES OF THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL AND SURROUNDING LANDS  IT ALLOWS FOR PROFESSIONAL FACILITATION AND OTHER SUPPORT FOR A RANGE OF PARTNERSHIP MEETINGS AND ACTIVITIES IN SUPPORT OF ATLP STRATEGIC GOALS SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES  THIS PROJECT PROVIDES PROJECT PLANNING SUPPORT AND FACILITATION FOR AN ATLP ANNUAL MEETING, VARIOUS MEETINGS AND ACTIVITIES OF THE ATLP STEERING COMMITTEE, REGULAR COORDINATION BETWEEN ATLP CO CONVENERS, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING THE WORK OF AD HOC COMMITTEES AND WORKING GROUPS  IT PROVIDES TARGETED FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO OFFSET COSTS OF ANNUAL MEETING ATTENDANCE FOR CERTAIN PARTICIPANTS  IT ALSO ENABLES THE ATLP TO UNDERTAKE A PROFESSIONAL BRANDING AND IDENTITY EXERCISE TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNICATIONS  FINALLY, IT ENABLES THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL CONSERVANCY  ATC  TO UNDERTAKE A SPATIAL ANALYSIS TO HELP IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE LAND PROTECTION OPPORTUNITIES PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  AN IN PERSON ATLP ANNUAL MEETING WILL BE HELD IN LATE 2022 WITH APPROXIMATELY 60 ORGANIZATIONAL REPRESENTATIVES, AS WELL AS A NUMBER OF PLANNED MEETINGS OF THE ATLP STEERING COMMITTEE AND OTHER ATLP PLANNING AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES  THE ATLP WILL FINALIZE ITS STRATEGIC PLAN AND WILL COMPLETE A BRANDING EXERCISE  ATC WILL COMPLETE A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT FOR THE SPATIAL ANALYSIS AND PRIORITIZATION OF LAND PROTECTION OPPORTUNITIES WITH CORRESPONDING REPORT BENEFICIARIES  APPALACHIAN TRAIL LANDSCAPE PARTNERSHIP PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC

THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OBJECTIVES PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT THROUGH FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENTS TO OPERATE, DEVELOP, AND MAINTAIN ANY PORTION OF SUCH A TRAIL EITHER WITHIN OR OUTSIDE A FEDERALLY ADMINISTERED AREA  THE GOALS OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE  NPS  AND AMERICAN TRAILS ARE TO PROVIDE AN OVERARCHING FRAMEWORK TO COORDINATE COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP WORK TO ACHIEVING MUTUAL GOALS IN TRAIL TRAINING AND INFORMATION, TRAIL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, STEWARDSHIP, AND RECREATION ACROSS NPS AND OTHER LANDS  THE PROJECTS WILL ENGAGE RECIPIENTS, PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND OR VISITORS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP ON ALL TRAIL TYPES AND ACROSS A RANGE OF TRAIL ACTIVITIES  BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC, STATES AND OR THEIR POLITICAL SUBDIVISIONS, LANDOWNERS, PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS, OR INDIVIDUALS

PURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  PERFORMANCE GOALS   ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS AND PARTNERS IN PRESERVING AND PROTECTING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ALONG THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL  APPA  THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF DEFERRED MAINTENANCE PROJECTS FOR CONTINUED VISITOR ACCESS AND ENJOYMENT PROJECT OBJECTIVES   PROJECT OBJECTIVES   THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO WORK WITH THE RECIPIENT TO REDUCE THE PARKS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG LIST AS IDENTIFIED IN THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM  PMIS  SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM REPAIR REHAB PROJECTS ON APPALACHIAN TRAIL  A T   FACILITIES LOCATED IN MULTIPLE STATES  WORK WILL REHABILITATE CRITICAL FACILITY ASSETS SUCH AS, SHELTERS, PRIVIES, CAMP SITES, PARKING AREAS, AND FOOT BRIDGES  PROJECT WORK WILL ALSO REPAIR AND REHABILITATE SEVERAL MILES OF HEAVILY DEGRADED AND ERODED TRAIL BY INSTALLING EROSION CONTROLLING STRUCTURES PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES PERFORMANCE GOALS WILL INCLUDE  PRODUCING ENGINEERING DESIGN PLANS FOR 3 BRIDGES  REHABILITATING 21 TREADWAY  REPLACING 3 TRAIL BRIDGES AND 6 PRIVIES  REHABILITATING 4 PRIVIES  REGRADING 2 PARKING AREAS  AND FORMALIZING 1 CAMPSITE BENEFICIARIES BENEFICIARIES ARE VISITORS, HIKERS, VOLUNTEERS, PARK STAFF, PARTNERS,AND YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NPS AND AHS IS TO PROMOTE, PROTECT, AND MAINTAIN TRAILS AND SURROUNDING NATURAL AREAS TO ALL WHO WISH TO ACCESS THEM, AND PROVIDE RECREATION ACCESS AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL AGES, BACKGROUNDS, COMMUNITIES, AND EXPERIENCE LEVELS. THIS PARTNERSHIP ALSO SEEKS TO GROW AND EMPOWER THE HIKING COMMUNITY, INCLUDING THE NEXT GENERATION OF HIKERS, TRAIL STEWARDS, PUBLIC LAND MANAGERS, AND OUTDOOR RECREATION LEADERS., AND BUILD A MORE INCLUSIVE, WELCOMING TRAIL COMMUNITY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NPS STAFF, AHS WILL ORGANIZE NATIONAL TRAILS DAY EVENTS AND VOLUNTEER VACATIONS AT NPS SITES THAT WILL ADDRESS PRESSING TRAIL MAINTENANCE NEEDS AND HIGHLIGHT THE BENEFITS OF NPS TRAILS AND THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WHICH INCLUDE NATIONAL SCENIC, HISTORIC AND RECREATION TRAILS, FOR ALL USERS. VOLUNTEER MAINTENANCE WILL RESULT IN TRAILS THAT WILL BE SAFE FOR THE PUBLIC TO USE AND BE SUSTAINABLY BUILT, WHICH WILL SIGNIFICANTLY DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF TRAIL UPKEEP AND MAINTENANCE EXPENSE IN THE FUTURE, PROVIDE INCREASED CAPACITY TO PARK UNITS AND NATIONAL TRAILS, AND ALLOW FOR MORE ENJOYMENT BY MORE OF THE PUBLIC. ADDITIONALLY, NATIONAL TRAILS DAY WILL INVITE AMERICANS OF ALL WALKS OF LIFE TO DISCOVER ALL THAT THEIR NPS SITES AND NATIONAL TRAILS HAVE TO OFFER AND GIVE BACK THROUGH STEWARDSHIP. NATIONAL TRAILS DAY EVENTS ALSO GET FAMILIES AND YOUTH FROM ALL COMMUNITIES OUTDOORS TO ENJOY THE PUBLIC FACILITIES AND INCREASE PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR THE NPS AND NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:WORK WITH NPS TO ORGANIZE, PLAN, AND      PROMOTE NATIONAL TRAILS DAY,      INCLUDING BOTH IN-PERSON EVENTS AND VIRTUAL PROMOTION.DEVELOP RESOURCES AND MATERIALS TO PROMOTE IN-PERSON EVENTS AND A       DIGITAL ACTIVATION AROUND NATIONAL TRAILS DAY. RECRUIT HOSTS FOR EVENTS ON NPS UNITS AND NATIONAL       TRAILS TO CONDUCT PUBLIC ACTIVITIES SUCH AS       HIKING, PADDLING, AND TRAIL MAINTENANCE FOR NATIONAL TRAILS DAY  .WITH NPS'S HELP,      IDENTIFY, AND SOLICIT NPS UNITS,      NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM OFFICES, AND PARTNERS TO HOST NATIONAL TRAILS DAY EVENTS ON NPS SITES AND PROVIDE SUPPORT MATERIALS, INCLUDING BILINGUAL HOST EVENT      GUIDES, TO ASSIST IN THE PLANNING      AND EXECUTION OF THE EVENTS;AMERICAN HIKING WILL ENGAGE THE PUBLIC WITH A DIGITAL ACTIVATION AROUND NATIONAL TRAILS DAY AND PROMOTE THE NATIONAL TRAILS DAY PLEDGE, AN EASY WAY FOR PEOPLE TO CARE FOR TRAILS EVEN WHILE SOCIAL DISTANCING. PROMOTE NATIONAL TRAILS DAY TO THE PUBLIC USING SOCIAL MEDIA AND OTHER MEDIA TO CONNECT AMERICANS FROM ALL WALKS OF LIFE TO THESE HEALTHY AND ENJOYABLE RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES TO BUILD THE BOND BETWEEN THE PUBLIC AND THEIR PARKS AND TRAILS. CREATE SPECIAL SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS FOR NATIONAL TRAILS DAY (254K+ FACEBOOK FOLLOWERS, 65K TWITTER FOLLOWERS, 74K INSTAGRAM FOLLOWERS AND VIA YOUTUBE); AND PROVIDE SPECIFIC MESSAGING ABOUT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRAIL STEWARDSHIP AND ENJOYMENT IN NPS SITES AND NATIONAL TRAILS.COORDINATE CONTENT SHARING BETWEEN AHS AND NPS RELATING TO #NATIONALTRAILSDAY SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS.BUILD PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AMERICA'S TRAILS AND PROMOTE NPS AND NATIONAL TRAIL ACTIVITIES SUCH AS HIKING, BIRDING, AND WILDLIFE PHOTOGRAPHY. PARTICIPATION AND PROMOTION OF NPS AND THE NTS THROUGH VOLUNTEER VACATIONS AND THE NEXTGEN TRAIL LEADER PROGRAM (YOUTH ENGAGEMENT)BENEFICIARIES: AMERICAN HIKING SOCIETY
CONDUCT ANNUAL MARCH ALONG OVERMOUNTAIN VICTORY NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL TO  EDUCATE YOUTH AND GENERAL PUBLIC AT LIVING HISTORY INTERPRETATION EVENTS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS AND PARTNERS IN PRESERVING AND PROTECTING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ALONG THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL (APPA) THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF DEFERRED MAINTENANCE PROJECTS FOR CONTINUED VISITOR ACCESS AND ENJOYMENT.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO WORK WITH THE RECIPIENT TO REDUCE THE PARKS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG LIST AS IDENTIFIED IN THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM (PMIS).SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM REPAIR REHAB PROJECTS ON APPALACHIAN TRAIL (A.T.) FACILITIES LOCATED IN MULTIPLE STATES. WORK WILL REHABILITATE CRITICAL FACILITY ASSETS SUCH AS, SHELTERS, PRIVIES, CAMP SITES, PARKING AREAS, AND FOOT BRIDGES. PROJECT WORK WILL ALSO REPAIR AND REHABILITATE SEVERAL MILES OF HEAVILY DEGRADED AND ERODED TRAIL BY INSTALLING EROSION CONTROLLING STRUCTURES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PERFORMANCE GOALS WILL INCLUDE: PRODUCING ENGINEERING DESIGN PLANS FOR 3 BRIDGES; REHABILITATING 21 TREADWAY; REPLACING 3 TRAIL BRIDGES AND 6 PRIVIES; REHABILITATING 4 PRIVIES; REGRADING 2 PARKING AREAS; AND FORMALIZING 1 CAMPSITE.BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES ARE VISITORS, HIKERS, VOLUNTEERS, PARK STAFF, PARTNERS, YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS AND US FOREST SERVICE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL CONSERVANCY WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT IN MANAGING THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL (APPA) VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. VOLUNTEERS ARE THE LIFEBLOOD OF THE TRAIL, AS THE TRAIL IS A COOPERATIVELY MANAGED UNIT OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL CONSERVANCY WILL ASSIGN STAFF TO WORK WITH APPA TO COORDINATE AND MAINTAIN A ROBUST VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. THE PROGRAM IS SUBSTANTIAL AND INCLUDES OVER 5,000 VOLUNTEERS FROM 14 STATES AND 30 TRAIL CLUBS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL CONSERVANCY WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE VOLUNTEER TRAIL CLUBS, TRAIL CREWS, AND INDIVIDUAL VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS TRAIL-WIDE, INCLUDING MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATION, SAFETY AND LEADERSHIP TRAINING, RECRUITMENT, RECOGNITION, AND COORDINATION OF VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:WORK WILL INCLUDE THE PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT AND HOSTING OF A VOLUNTEER LEADERSHIP MEETING, 8 REGIONAL PARTNERSHIP COMMITTEE MEETINGS AND SAWYER TRAINING WORKSHOPS. APPALACHIAN TRAIL CONSERVANCY WILL ALSO MANAGE THE COORDINATION AND MONITORING OF THE PARK'S VOLUNTEER PROGRAM.BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES ARE VISITORS, HIKERS, VOLUNTEERS, PARK STAFF, PARTNERS, YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS, AND COMMUNITIES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE COOPERATIVELY THE MISSIONS OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND THE RECIPIENT THROUGH RESEARCHING RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH THE WASHINGTON-ROCHAMBEAU REVOLUTIONARY ROUTE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (WARO) AND IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE WARO LONG RANGE INTERPRETIVE PLAN AND COMMEMORATING AMERICA'S 250TH ANNIVERSARY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:COORDINATING WITH PARTNER SITES AND ORGANIZATIONS WITH HISTORIC SITES INTERSECTING THE TRAIL TO DEVELOP, COORDINATE, AND PROMOTE PROGRAMMING WHICH ENGAGES, INSPIRES, AND EDUCATES THE PUBLIC ABOUT WARO AND ITS RESOURCES.RECIPIENT WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE NEWPORT HISTORICAL SOCIETY FOR HOSTING REVOLUTIONARY WEEKEND IN JULY 2022; AND PARTICIPATE IN HISTORICAL RESEARCH FOR ROUTE WAYFINDING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TO PROTECT THE RESOURCES OF WARO BY ALLOWING FOR THEIR RESEARCH AND DOCUMENTATION, AND THE STEWARDSHIP OF THOSE RESOURCES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THIS AND FUTURE GENERATIONS, PURSUANT TO THE LEGAL AUTHORITIES AUTHORIZING THIS ACTIVITY; AND TO PROVIDE ENHANCED PUBLIC INTERPRETATION, EDUCATION AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO WARO RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES:WASHINGTON ROCHAMBEAU REVOLUTIONARY ROUTE ASSOCIATION, INC. (W3R-US)

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS AND PARTNERS IN PRESERVING AND PROTECTING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ALONG THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL (APPA) THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF CYCLIC MAINTENANCE PROJECTS FOR CONTINUED VISITOR ACCESS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - PERFORM IDENTIFIED CYCLIC MAINTENANCE TASKS AS SCHEDULED TO PREVENT THEM FROM BEING ADDED TO THE PARK'S DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG LIST. ACCOMPLISHING THESE EFFORTS WILL DIRECTLY SUPPORT DOI SECRETARY PRIORITY "10: 8.C.2. PRIORITIZE DOI INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS TO HIGHLIGHT CYCLICAL MAINTENANCE."SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL PERFORM CYCLIC MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ALONG A.T. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE CLEARING VEGETATION AND DEBRIS ALONG 248.6 MILES OF BOUNDARY AND MOWING, RECLAIMING, BUSH HOGGING, AND HERBICIDE TREATING 76 (593 AC) MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES SITES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:76 (593 AC) OF MAINTAINED LANDSCAPE SITES WILL BE MAINTAINED AND 248.6 BOUNDARY MILES WILL BE DELINEATED.BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES ARE VISITORS, HIKERS, VOLUNTEERS, PARK STAFF, PARTNERS, YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS AND US FOREST SERVICE.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTS PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON ENHANCING VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TO PROVIDE INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS, RECREATION AND RETRACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES ALONG THE EL CAMINO REAL DE LOS TEJAS NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL AND RELATED SITES THROUGH INTERPRETATION, AND FOR PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:A. ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE AWARENESS, ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE EL CAMINO REAL DE LOS TEJAS NHT.B. SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE ABOVE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE AN ASSOCIATION MANAGER TO OVERSEE ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE EL CAMINO REAL DE LOS TEJAS TRAIL ASSOCIATION IN SUPPORT OF PROJECT GOALS. TASKS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER TRAVEL, ASSOCIATION QUARTERLY BOARD MEETINGS, PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT VIA PRINT AND DIGITAL MEDIA, TRAIL SIGNING, INTERPRETATION, CERTIFICATION, AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE INTERFACE AND ENGAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:EL CAMINO REAL DE LOS TEJAS TRAIL ASSOCIATION

PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TRAINED INDIVIDUALS TO HIKE THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL DURING PEAK SEASONS TO ASSIST WITH VISITOR EDUCATION, SAFETY, AND LIGHT MAINTENANCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS BACKCOUNTRY AND TRAIL OPERATIONS IN SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK. RIDGERUNNERS CONDUCT HIKES ON THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL TO PROVIDE GENERAL ASSISTANCE TO BACKCOUNTRY VISITORS, EDUCATE VISITORS IN LEAVE NO TRACE MINIMUM IMPACT BACKCOUNTRY USE ETHICS AND TECHNIQUES; AND PROVIDE LIGHT MAINTENANCE ALONG THE TRAIL.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: RIDGERUNNERS WILL BE EXPECTED TO PERFORM DUTIES WHICH WILL CONSIST OF HIKING ON FOOT THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL IN SHENANDOAH NP IN FIVE-DAY/OVERNIGHT SHIFTS, CAMPING AT OR NEAR HUT LOCATIONS WHICH ARE FREQUENTED BY OVERNIGHT TRAIL USERS. DURING THESE SHIFTS, THE RIDGERUNNERS WILL CONTACT AT THRU-HIKERS AND BACKCOUNTRY USERS TO INFORM AND EDUCATE; PROVIDE FIRST AID TO INDIVIDUAL LEVEL OF CERTIFICATION AND COMFORT; REPORT SUSPICIOUS/ILLEGAL BEHAVIOR AND MEDICAL EMERGENCIES; PERFORM LIGHT MAINTENANCE ON BACKCOUNTRY TRAIL; AND RECORD STATISTICS OF TRAIL-USERS CONTACTED AND WORK PERFORMED AND ISSUE WEEKLY REPORTS.BENEFICIARIES: THE RIDGERUNNERS GAIN VALUABLE JOB SKILLS AS THEY LEARN ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS WHICH INCREASES THEIR UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR CONSERVATION EFFORTS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP SKILLS THAT CAN TRANSFER TO REAL WORLD SITUATIONS AND FUTURE JOB OPPORTUNITIES. THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS INTERNSHIP BY HAVING A GREATER, MORE FREQUENT PRESENCE ALONG THE APPALACHIAN TRAIL TO PROVIDE EDUCATION, AWARENESS AND IMPROVED SAFETY.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTS PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON ENHANCING VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TO PROVIDE INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS, RECREATION AND RETRACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES ALONG THE OLD SPANISH NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL AND RELATED SITES THROUGH INTERPRETATION, AND FOR PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:A. ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE AWARENESS, ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE OLD SPANISH NHT.B. SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE ABOVE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE AN ASSOCIATION MANAGER TO OVERSEE ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE OLD SPANISH TRAIL ASSOCIATION IN SUPPORT OF PROJECT GOALS. TASKS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER TRAVEL, ASSOCIATION BIANNUAL BOARD MEETINGS, PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT VIA PRINT AND DIGITAL MEDIA, TRAIL SIGNING, INTERPRETATION, CERTIFICATION, AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE INTERFACE AND ENGAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:OLD SPANISH TRAIL ASSOCIATION

ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE AWARENESS, ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE TRAIL OF TEARS NHT.B. TASKS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER TRAVEL, ASSOCIATION BIANNUAL BOARD MEETINGS, PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT VIA PRINT AND DIGITAL MEDIA, TRAIL SIGNING, INTERPRETATION, CERTIFICATION, ROUTE REFINEMENT AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE INTERFACE AND ENGAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:TRAIL OF TEARS ASSOCIATION

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON ENHANCING VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TO PROVIDE INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS, RECREATION AND RETRACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES ALONG THE OREGON AND CALIFORNIA NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS AND RELATED SITES THROUGH INTERPRETATION, AND FOR PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:A. ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE AWARENESS, ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE OREGON AND CALIFORNIA NHTS.B. SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE ABOVE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE AN ASSOCIATION MANAGER TO OVERSEE ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE OREGON-CALIFORNIA TRAILS ASSOCIATION IN SUPPORT OF PROJECT GOALS. TASKS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER TRAVEL, ASSOCIATION BIANNUAL BOARD MEETINGS, PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT VIA PRINT AND DIGITAL MEDIA, TRAIL SIGNING, INTERPRETATION, CERTIFICATION, ROUTE REFINEMENT AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE INTERFACE AND ENGAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:OREGON-CALIFORNIA TRAILS ASSOCIATION

?COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT FOCUSES ON ENHANCING VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TO PROVIDE INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS, RECREATION AND RETRACEMENT OPPORTUNITIES ALONG THE SANTA FE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (NHT) AND RELATED SITES THROUGH INTERPRETATION, AND FOR PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:A. ENCOURAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTOR PARTICIPATION IN THE AWARENESS, ACQUISITION, PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, OPERATION, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE SANTA FE NHT.B. SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS IN THE ABOVE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE AN ASSOCIATION MANAGER TO OVERSEE ALL ACTIVITIES OF THE SANTA FE TRAIL ASSOCIATION IN SUPPORT OF PROJECT GOALS. TASKS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING VOLUNTEER TRAVEL, ASSOCIATION BIANNUAL BOARD MEETINGS, PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT VIA PRINT AND DIGITAL MEDIA, TRAIL SIGNING, INTERPRETATION, CERTIFICATION, ROUTE REFINEMENT AND PUBLIC/PRIVATE INTERFACE AND ENGAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:SANTA FE TRAIL ASSOCIATION

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): TO PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND DEVELOP THE COMPONENTS OF THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON VOLUNTEER INVOLVEMENT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE LEWIS AND CLARK NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL GEOTOURISM PROGRAM HAS BEEN WORKING SINCE 2017 TO ENGAGE TOURISM STAKEHOLDERS TO WORK TOGETHER TO PROTECT, MANAGE, AND PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE TOURISM ALONG THE TRAIL. THE GOAL OF THIS FIVE-YEAR PROGRAM WAS TO FACILITATE WISE STEWARDSHIP OF CULTURAL, HISTORIC, AND NATURAL RESOURCES WHILE ENHANCING LOCAL ECONOMIES BY HELPING DESTINATIONS TELL THEIR STORY INTERNALLY AND TO THEIR TARGETED TRAVEL MARKETS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO CONTINUE THE EFFORTS OF THIS PROGRAM AND SUSTAIN THESE EVER-IMPORTANT PARTNERSHIPS, THE WORK HAS BEEN DEVELOPED TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: "CONTINUE TO BUILD UPON THE LEWISANDCLARK.TRAVEL WEBSITE IN THE FORM OF INCREASED LISTINGS, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP AND MARKETING EFFORTS TO REACH THE TRAVELING PUBLIC" ESTABLISH A GOVERNANCE MODEL THAT WILL OVERSEE AN ORGANIZATION THAT CREATES INTRINSIC VALUE FOR THE MANY STATES, COMMUNITIES, BUSINESSES, TRIBES, FEDERAL LAND MANAGERS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT LIE ALONG THE TRAIL."BENEFICIARIES: PROFIT ORGANIZATION

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) IS WORKING WITH PRIDE OF BALTIMORE, INC (PRIDE) TO PROVIDE FREE ON-WATER PROGRAMS AND DOCKSIDE ACTIVITIES AT CHESAPEAKE BAY TOWNS ALONG THE STAR-SPANGLED BANNER NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (TRAIL). THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO ENGAGE WITH UNDER-REPRESENTED COMMUNITIES; ENCOURAGE STEWARDSHIP OF THE TRAIL AND ITS RESOURCES; AND INCREASE PUBLIC USE AND AWARENESS OF PRIDE OF BALTIMORE II, A REPLICA WAR OF 1812 PRIVATEER SCHOONER.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PROGRAM WILL REACH EIGHT CHESAPEAKE BAY PORT TOWNS AND AT EACH, FAMILIES AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BE ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN DAY SAILS AND DOCKSIDE TOURS. A UNIFORMED NPS RANGER WILL PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS PROGRAM WILL HELP THE PUBLIC CONNECT TO THE TRAIL THROUGH VISITOR INFORMATION AND INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING. THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW NPS TO HAVE A MOBILE, ON-WATER INTERPRETIVE PRESENCE THROUGHOUT THE REGION AT VARIOUS LOCATIONS ALONG THE TRAIL. MOREOVER, PROGRAMMING WITH PRIDE WILL INCREASE VISITOR INTEREST AND RAISE AWARENESS OF THE WAR OF 1812 IN THE CHESAPEAKE AND HELP SET THE FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE STEWARDSHIP OF THE TRAIL AND ITS NATIONALLY SIGNIFICANT CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES:FAMILIES AND GENERAL PUBLIC AT VARIOUS PORT TOWNS AROUND THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADVANCE, DEVELOP, PROTECT, AND MAINTAIN THE NORTH COUNTRY NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL (NOCO). THIS ACHIEVED THROUGH COOPERATIVE PLANNING BY THE NPS AND NORTH COUNTRY TRAIL ASSOCIATION (NCTA) THE RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND COORDINATION OF VOLUNTEERS ACROSS THE LENGTH OF THE TRAIL. NCTA COORDINATES THE VOLUNTEER EFFORT ALONG THE OVER 4800 MILE LENGTH OF THE TRAIL THROUGH A NETWORK OF CHAPTERS AND LOCAL PARTNERS. NCTA ALSO COORDINATES THE NATIONAL MARKETING AND OUTREACH EFFORTS TO GROW AWARENESS OF THE NOCO AND CREATE A SENSE OF COMMUNITY AND COMMON PURPOSE. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PARTIALLY SUPPORT NCTA STAFF WHICH SUPPORT AND COORDINATE THE WORK OF THE TRAIL VOLUNTEERS IN THE PROTECTION, BUILDING, MAINTENANCE, DEVELOPMENT, AND PROMOTION OF NOCO.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SECURE PRIVATE SECTOR FUNDING AND OTHER RESOURCES NEEDED FOR TRAIL DEVELOPMENT, PROTECTION, AND PROMOTION. IDENTIFY AND INFORM THE NPS OF TRAIL, VOLUNTEER AND ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS AND EMERGING OPPORTUNITIES TO ENSURE THE TIMELY AND EFFECTIVE DEVELOPMENT, MAINTENANCE, PROTECTION AND PROMOTION OF THE TRAIL. STRENGTHEN MEMBERSHIP/VOLUNTEERS UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NOCO. PARTICIPATE WITH THE NPS AND OTHER COOPERATING INTERESTS TO PREPARE LONG-RANGE PLANS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND PROTECTION OF NOCO. GROW PUBLIC AWARENESS AND USE OF THE TRAIL BY DEVELOPING A MARKETING AND AWARENESS PROGRAM CARRIED OUT THROUGH VARIOUS FORMS OF MEDIA, EVENTS AND CAMPAIGNS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL WORKPLAN.BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC, VOLUNTEERS, NCTA
